alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:41AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knott, southern Floyd and Pike Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 440 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mousie, or 8 miles northeast of Hindman, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Demo, Dry Creek and Halo around 445 AM EDT. Wheelwright, Orkney, East McDowell, Craynor, Price, McDowell, Hi Hat, Buckhorn Hollow, Minnie and Drift around 450 AM EDT. Galveston, Beaver, Osborn, Grethel, Boldman, Aluba, Harold and Virgie around 455 AM EDT. Pikeville, Coal Run Village and Coal Run around 500 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
